Hello Robin:

See below.

bjhong02 wrote:

>
> I use heritrix-1.2.0 with default profile. The Crawl Scope is
> DomainScope, but the crawl is not limited to the domain defined by
> the seed.

In default configuration, the crawler will leave the scope to follow 
redirects or to get embedded items up to a maximum of  
'max-trans-hops'.  Change this setting to stop this happening.  
Currently, if you set this value to zero, the crawler won't crawl; it 
stops with a -63 on first fetch.  This is a bug ('[ 1090564 ] 
max-trans-hops=0 generates -63 in crawl.log').  Try with a setting of '1'.

>
> also, I'm not clear about some concepts mentioned in the user manual.
>
> 1. if I use the BraodScope, set the max-link-hops to 0  (unlimited),
> and with some representative seeds, I can crawl the whole web. am i
> right?

Looking at the code, 0 is zero link hops, not unlimited hops.  There is 
no way of specifying unlimited (We need to be more consistent about 
no-limit values across all settings).  Choose something other than 0 (or 
-1) to do your broad-crawl.

But be aware that Heritrix currently doesn't do a good job broadcrawling 
currently (See 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/releasenotes.html#1_0_0_limitations).

>
> 2. what's the difference between domain and host mentioned in
> DomainScope and HostScope.

I added examples to the manual to try and make this clearer.  Please 
check it out: http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#scopes.

>
> 3. give some examples for FilterScope and SurtPrefixScope.

I also added examples to the manual for FilterScope and also a pointer 
to a wiki that has more on SurtScope.

Hope this helps.
St.Ack
